## Mojito

A mojito is a refreshing Cuban drink made with white rum, sugar, lime juice, soda water, and mint. To make one, you mix lime juice, sugar, and mint leaves, then add rum and stir. Finally, you add ice and soda water. It's a popular summer drink because of its sweet, tangy, and minty flavors. In Cuba, they use a special mint called yerba buena, but elsewhere, spearmint is often used.
